function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"High levels of CO2 emissions due to reduced impact of lockdown measures","Impact":"The continued high level of emissions can contribute to climate breakdown and its associated negative impacts, such as extreme weather events, rising sea levels, and ecosystem disruption.","Mitigation":"Implementing measures to reduce CO2 emissions through sustainable practices, circular economy, and low-carbon models.","Technologies":"Renewable energy technologies, carbon capture and storage, waste management technologies","People":"Global population, particularly those living in areas vulnerable to climate change impacts","Owner":"Governments, industries, communities"},{"Description":"High cost of reducing CO2 emissions during the lockdown","Impact":"The high cost of reducing emissions during the lockdown indicates the inefficiency of current mitigation measures and the need for a more cost-effective approach.","Mitigation":"Developing and implementing cost-effective strategies for reducing CO2 emissions, promoting circular economy and low-carbon practices.","Technologies":"Data-driven optimization tools, sustainable supply chain management technologies, energy-efficient solutions","People":"Economists, policymakers, industry leaders","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies, industry associations"},{"Description":"Prediction of climate breakdown as a greater threat than COVID-19","Impact":"The prediction of climate breakdown as a greater threat to global health highlights the urgent need for effective measures to mitigate climate change and its potential health impacts.","Mitigation":"Integrating climate-conscious policies and practices into public health strategies, fostering cross-sector collaboration for climate mitigation and public health protection.","Technologies":"Integrated environmental monitoring systems, public health data analytics, sustainable urban planning technologies","People":"Global population, public health agencies, climate scientists","Owner":"Government agencies, public health organizations, climate research institutions"}]}
